summary:
Cao\'s Extra Pockets Perk Upgrades
Extra Pockets Perk has 5 ranks.
this mod makes the pickpocket tree perk have 5 ranks instead of 1
descriptionHtml:
*(the screenshot also shows this mod http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=3717)

Extra Pockets Perk has 5 ranks.
this mod makes the pickpocket tree perk have 5 ranks instead of 1

there is many choices for your taste. ONLY PICK ONE .esp to put in your DATA folder.

D100_100s means default is +100 to carry capacity, each upgrade is another 100 ... when you have all, +500
D100_80s   means default is +100, each UP is 80 ... all together is +420
D100_60s   means default is +100, each UP is 60 ... all together is +340
D80_80s    means default is +80, each UP is 80 ... all together is +400
D60_60s    means default is +60, each UP is 60 ... all together is +300
even more, like a Cheat
D120_120s  default +120, each up is 120 ... all together is +600
++Ascending++
D40_ASC    default is 40, UPs to 60, 80, 100, 120 ... all together is +400
....
++NOREQ++
each of these variants also have a
\"NOREQ\" version, which means, you do not need any pickpocket skill or perks. 
So the first perk point you get in the game you can upgrade your carry capacity if you choose to.




+++++ HOW TO INSTALL +++++
place one of the \"cao_extrapockets_XXX\" into Skyrim DATA folder
ONLY USE ONE FILE... pick the one you like best.

in the launcher tick the checkbox. ... data files grayed out? -scroll down*


==============
***
use anyway u want, what do i care?
i think licenses are BS ...
if i made a stone wheel, and no one could alter it.... there would be no rubber tires...
CaoMengde777
peace.

==============



---------------------------------
*Data Files grayed out?
---------------------------------
Go to: Drive Letter:\\Program Files\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\\Skyrim\\SkyrimPrefs.ini

For those who don\'t have bought the game on steam, the SkyrimPrefs.ini file is located in Drive Letter:\\Users\\<USERNAME>\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim

Add these lines, or change them if they already exist so they match the below:
	[Launcher]
	bEnableFileSelection=1

If that fails:
	Go to: Drive Letter:\\Users\\[USERNAME]\\AppData\\Local\\Skyrim
	Make the Skyrim folder un-read only.
author: CaoMengde777
